column5: I installed a weather module..if you like..it stays..if not..she goes.  You have to program your town first time but after that, it should always go to that one. You can switch...not as many Ontario towns as I'd like...but what ya gonna do??
dont forget, you have the default skin to worry about.
Dopie me,thanks Rick...Just got the chance to look around but missed that...Thanks for the great work!!
d'oh. but I like it.  much less clutter and simpler.
hey rick i was wondering why not just put the weathernetwork there its the most common one ,and covers just about everywhere??????

Well it's a try, but, could not find one town/village/landmark even remotely close to Lk Simcoe...then I see Bagotville, mon dieu, maudit bleuet de *#@*, my first base 35 years ago. Maybe a direct link to theweathernet.ca and then the respective area you're looking for.
Just used it Rick, nice touch.  Regards, Sam
nice try, but missing a whole lot Barrie Newmarket  didn't expect Keswick or Georgina and wasn't disappointed

I dont understand this farenheit thing....LOL.  I got all excited for a minute and thought it was going to be 30C!!!  Should probably look for a more Canadian friendly service....I noticed the selection of towns and cities a bit lacking....I live in the burbs of Toronto, but many will not find weather close to their lakes...
Yeah the farenheit thing threw me off but it also has celsius next to it  Thanks for the weather feature nice lil extra. Tony

Good idea, but this particular program is definitely lacking.  I live 5 minutes from CFB Borden which has a vast array of meteorological equipment, yet it isn't on the list, no colingwood, barrie etc.
